vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
τᾰλαντ-ιαῖος, α, ον,
worth a talent, οἶκος [Refs 4th c.BC+]; νοσήματα τ. costing a talent, probably in fee to the physician, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__2 of persons, worth a talent, i.e. possessed of one, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; ἔγγυοι τ. giving surety to the amount of a talent, [Refs 4th c.BC+]
__II weighing a talent, ξύλον [Refs]; λιθοβόλος τ. an engine throwing stones of a talent weight, [Refs 2nd c.BC+]; πετροβόλος τ. [Refs 3rd c.BC+]
__II.2 in which the prize is a talent, ἀγών [Refs]
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
weighing a talent (about 57 to 80 lbs.)
of a talent weight, weighing a talent, Rev. 16:21*
vocabInfos._es_Definition: peso de un talento (tal vez alredador de 40 kilos)
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition:
1) 他連得重 (啟16:21)
1a) 一他連得的銀子重約 100 磅 (45 公斤)
1b) 一他連得的金子重約 200 磅 (91 公斤)
vocabInfos._zh_Definition:
1) 他连得重 (启16:21)
1a) 一他连得的银子重约 100 磅 (45 公斤)
1b) 一他连得的金子重约 200 磅 (91 公斤)
vocabInfos._vi_Definition: ta-lăng-tông hay ta-lâng. Một ta-lâng cân nặng khoảng (ta lâng bạc) 40/45 đến (ta lâng vàng) 90 kí-lô.
